The genitive case in German grammar is used to show possession, relationships between nouns, and to express certain types of actions. It is usually indicated by adding an "-s" or "-es" ending to the end of a noun or a noun phrase. The genitive is also used after certain prepositions and verbs, and can be used to replace possessive pronouns. While the genitive case is still used in modern German, it is not as common as it used to be and has been partially replaced by the dative case with prepositions.
ist sehr lang. (The tail of the dog is very long.)
ist sehr groß. (My friend's apartment is very large.)
verändert sich im Herbst. (The color of the leaves changes in autumn.)
bellt oft. (The neighbor's dog barks often.)
sind blau. (The child's eyes are blue.)
ist unbeschreiblich. (The beauty of nature is indescribable.)
berührt meine Seele. (The sound of the music touches my soul.)
liegt auf dem Tisch. (My brother's book is lying on the table.)
passen nicht zu ihrem Kleid. (The woman's shoes do not match her dress.)

Präteritum (also known as "simple past" or "preterite") is a grammatical tense in German that is used to describe actions or events that occurred in the past. It is commonly used in written texts, formal speech, and in some regions of Germany in spoken language.
The Präteritum tense is formed by conjugating the verb stem and adding specific endings depending on the subject. For example, the verb "sprechen" (to speak) in Präteritum is:

ich sprach (I spoke)
du sprachst (you spoke)
er/sie/es sprach (he/she/it spoke)
wir sprachen (we spoke)
ihr spracht (you all spoke)
sie sprachen (they spoke)

In spoken German, the Präteritum tense is often replaced by the Perfekt tense, which is formed with an auxiliary verb (usually "haben" or "sein") and the past participle of the main verb. The Perfekt tense is used in everyday conversation and is considered more colloquial than the Präteritum tense.
As they are often used in fairy tales (märchen) one of the best ways to study Präteritum is to read fairy tales.

Seitdem waren die Maus und der Löwe gute Freunde und halfen sich immer wieder gegenseitig.

Partizip I (also known as "present participle" or "gerund") in German is a non-finite verb form that ends in "-end", "-ierend", or "-end" depending on the verb. It is formed by adding the suffix "-end" or "-ierend" to the verb stem, and can function as an adjective, a noun or a verb.
As an adjective, Partizip I describes an
, state or condition. It can be used to describe a person, an object or a situation. As partizip I converts verb to an adjektiv it is also followed by adjective declination:
erlebt sein Leben, am Gedankenlosen zieht es vorbei.
(Only the thinking one experiences the life, it passes by the thoughtless one.)
In German, the future tense is usually formed using the auxiliary verb
(to become) followed by the infinitive form of the main verb.
The use case of Futur I is to describe
tasks in the future. For regular tasks Präsens is often used.
To form the future tense, you need to use the appropriate form of "werden" followed by the infinitive form of the main verb. For example:
. (I will go to the cinema tomorrow.)
. (He will change his job next year.)
. (We will go on holiday next week.)
. (You will have a lot of fun tonight.)
in Zukunft mehr Zeit für sich
. (They will have more time for themselves in the future.)

Note that the future tense can also be expressed using the present tense, especially in spoken German. For example, instead of saying "Ich werde morgen ins Kino gehen" you could also say "Ich gehe morgen ins Kino", which means the same thing.

The Plusquamperfekt (Pluperfect) is a past tense in German that describes an action that had already happened before another action in the past. It is formed by using the auxiliary verb "haben" or "sein" in the Imperfekt (simple past) tense and adding the past participle of the main verb.
The Plusquamperfekt is a past tense in German that describes an action that had already happened before another action in the past. It is formed by using the auxiliary verb

"Passiversatzformen" in German refers to constructions that are used as alternatives to the typical passive voice structure. These are constructions that convey a passive-like meaning without using the standard "werden" (to be) + past participle combination. Instead, they often involve using reflexive pronouns or certain verbs.

In English, "Passiversatzformen" translates to "passive substitute forms" or "alternative passive constructions." These constructions are used when speakers want to express a passive idea but choose to do so in a different grammatical structure.
Man kann die Kopie nicht nur einfach lesen.
Die Kopie kann nur schwer gelesen werden.
Die Kopie ist nur schwer zu lesen.
Die Kopie lässt sich nur schwer lesen.
Das Kopie ist nur schwer lesbar.

Passive voice is a grammatical construction in which the subject of a sentence is the recipient of the action, rather than the performer of the action. In other words, in a passive sentence, the thing being acted upon is the grammatical subject of the sentence, while the agent (the entity that is performing the action) is often relegated to a prepositional phrase or omitted altogether.

For example, in the active sentence "John ate the pizza," "John" is the subject and the performer of the action, while "pizza" is the object and the thing being acted upon. In the passive version of this sentence, "The pizza was eaten by John," "pizza" becomes the subject, while "John" is introduced via a prepositional phrase.

Passive voice is often used when the speaker wants to emphasize the thing being acted upon or when the performer of the action is unknown, irrelevant, or intentionally being obscured. However, passive voice can sometimes make sentences more wordy and harder to understand, so it's important to use it judiciously.

Conditional clauses express a condition and its possible outcome. In German, they often use subordinating conjunctions like "wenn", "falls", and "sofern", as well as prepositions like "bei", "im Falle", "mit", and "ohne". Here's an explanation of each:
Wenn ich Zeit habe, werde ich ins Kino gehen.
Falls es regnet, bleiben wir zu Hause.
Ich komme zur Party, sofern ich eingeladen werde.
Bei Regen nehmen wir einen Regenschirm mit.
Im Falle eines Unfalls, rufen Sie bitte die Polizei.
Im Falle eines Unfalls, rufen Sie bitte die Polizei.
Mit genügend Vorbereitung, können wir das schaffen.
Ohne deine Hilfe schaffen wir es nicht.
These conjunctions and prepositions are used to introduce the conditional clause, which is followed by the main clause indicating the consequence or result.
Wenn es regnet, werde ich zu Hause bleiben. (If it rains, I will stay at home.)
Bei gutem Wetter gehen wir spazieren. (In the case of good weather, we'll go for a walk.)
Falls du kommst, lade ich dich ein. (If you come, I'll invite you.)
Mit deiner Unterstützung können wir das schaffen. (With your support, we can achieve it.)
Im Falle eines Stromausfalls, haben wir einen Notstromgenerator. (In the event of a power outage, we have a backup generator.)

In German grammar, "Konsekutivsätze oder Folgesätze" (consecutive clauses) are subordinate clauses that express a consequence or result. These clauses typically follow a main clause that expresses an action or situation, and they indicate what happens as a result of that action or situation.
| Es regnete stark, wir mussten drinnen
| Die Straßen waren vereist, es kam zu vielen

In German, a "Relativsatz" is a relative clause. Relative clauses provide additional information about a noun in the main clause and are introduced by relative pronouns such as "der," "die," "das," "welcher," "welche," "welches," etc. These pronouns are used to refer back to a noun in the main clause, connecting the two clauses.
Here's a simple example in English:
Main clause: The book is interesting.
that I bought yesterday is interesting.

In this example, "das ich gestern gekauft habe" (that I bought yesterday) is the relative clause, providing additional information about the noun "Buch" (book) in the main clause. The relative pronoun "das" is used to connect the two clauses.

of the relative pronoun with the noun it refers to in the main clause. The choice of the relative pronoun depends on the gender and case of the noun, as well as whether the noun is a person or a thing.

This table shows the declension of relative pronouns based on gender and case. Note that the plural form for the dative and genitive cases is the same: "denen" for dative and "deren" for genitive. The relative pronouns in the genitive case (dessen and deren) indicate possession or association.
... die ich letzten Sommer besucht habe.
... das ich mir gestern gekauft habe.
... dem ich das Buch gegeben habe.
... das ich meiner Freundin gegeben habe.
... mit denen ich gestern gesprochen habe.
... in dem wir letztes Jahr gewohnt haben.

Die indirekte Rede kann durch einen Einleitungssatz signalisiert werden (1). Dann kann die folgende Ausage im Indikativ oder Konjunktiv I stehen. Die Indirekte Rede kann auch nur durch den Gebrauch des Konjunktiv I zum Ausdruck gebracht werden (2).
Bei der Umwandlung von direkter in indirekte Rede müssen Pronomen, Posesssivartikel und ggf. Zeit- und Ortsangaben angepasst werden.

Typische TP-Aufgabenstellungen, auch wenn wir das schon vor langer Zeit besprochen haben:
In der DSH (Deutsche Sprachprüfung für den Hochschulzugang) gibt es in der Aufgabenstellung für die Textproduktion typische Verben, die verwendet werden, um die Aufgaben klar und eindeutig zu formulieren. Diese Verben geben den Prüflingen Anweisungen, wie sie den Text verfassen sollen. Hier sind einige typische Verben, die häufig in den Aufgabenstellungen vorkommen:

Beschreiben: Einen Sachverhalt, eine Grafik oder eine Situation detailliert und präzise darstellen.
Erklären: Einen Sachverhalt oder eine Aussage verständlich und nachvollziehbar erläutern.
Vergleichen: Gemeinsamkeiten und Unterschiede zwischen zwei oder mehreren Dingen herausarbeiten.
Diskutieren: Verschiedene Standpunkte zu einem Thema darstellen und abwägen.
Analysieren: Einzelne Aspekte eines Themas oder Sachverhalts detailliert untersuchen und bewerten.
Erläutern: Etwas ausführlich und verständlich darstellen, oft mit Beispielen oder zusätzlichen Informationen.
Darstellen: Eine Übersicht über einen Sachverhalt oder ein Thema geben.
Bewerten: Ein Thema oder einen Sachverhalt kritisch betrachten und eine persönliche Meinung dazu formulieren.
Begründen: Argumente für oder gegen etwas anführen und nachvollziehbare Gründe liefern.
Erörtern: Ein Thema umfassend behandeln, indem Pro- und Kontra-Argumente dargestellt werden.
Stellen Sie dar: Ähnlich wie "darstellen", oft im Zusammenhang mit der Präsentation von Informationen oder Fakten.
Nennen: Einzelne Punkte oder Aspekte aufzählen.

Die Einleitung nimmt den Leser an die Hand und führt ihn an das Thema heran. Am Emde der Einleitung steht die zentrale Frage oder These, die Sie in dem Text behandeln möchten. Bei der Formulierung der zentralen Frage oder These sollte sich Folgendes überlegen:
-> Wozu schreibt man den Text überhaupt?
-> Was ist der Fokus des Textes bzw. der Aufgabenstellung?
Die zentrale Frage wird offen formuliert, häufig als indirekte Frage (... die Frage, ob / wann / warum ...).

kann eine aktuelle Situation oder Entwicklung beschreiben. Er bleibt generell bzw. allgemein, um langsam heranzuführen (z.B. Es gibt ..., Immer mehr Menschen ...). Maanchmal können die ersten beiden Punkte - allgemeiner Einleitungssatz und Thema - auch in einem Satz zusammengefasst werden. Zwei bis drei Sätze können also für die Einleitung schon genug sein. Es ist wichtig, die Einleitung allgemein zu halten und noch keine konkreten Details zu nennen.

DSH or Deutsche Sprachprüfung für den Hochschulzugang (German Language Examination for University Entrance) which is a standardized test for non-native speakers of German who wish to study at German universities.
Examination held in four parts. Those are:
While the first three parts handled in the same day with a breaks. Oral examination is held in another day if the person passes the written part of the exam.
DSH is not distributed to multiple speaking levels. So there is only one examination. And the level determined by the mistake level of attendant.

Leseverstehen consists of two sub-parts, in first parts participant needs to read a scientific article and answer some questions. These questions does not require reformulation could be written as they are existed in the text. Wissenschaftliche Struktur is the second part of this section. It checks grammatical correction and heavy reformulation of the sentences of correct grammatical structures with required knowledge in various grammatical concepts. Both of the subsections held in one single part lasts 70 minutes.
Listening part is held in 4 parts:
1 A written vocal presentation is read by one of the persons helding the exam. During this phase it is allowed to take notes.
2 Task papers are given to the students, and 10 minutes time given for them to read.
3 Vocal presentation is read a second time, in this time student may extend their notes or write answers directly to the exam paper.
4 40 Minutes exam time given to fill exam paper.

An academic writing task consists on a single thema with one or multiple questions are presented to the exam takers of optimal 200-250 words. The task could be either argumentative text an opinion or objective articulation on the thema within 70 minutes to complete. The text is expected to have clean structure with introduction, body and conclusion parts. The grading process is relatively complex and student expected to success minimum 67% of the total exam. If student writes under 150 word the exam is concluded as not passed while less than 200 words resulting in the deduction of 1, and 175 words deduction of 2 points. Second most important aspect is to position and conjugation of verbs as they are regarded a 1 point mistake.

"Passiversatzformen" in German refers to constructions that are used as alternatives to the typical passive voice structure. These are constructions that convey a passive-like meaning without using the standard "werden" (to be) + past participle combination. Instead, they often involve using reflexive pronouns or certain verbs.

In English, "Passiversatzformen" translates to "passive substitute forms" or "alternative passive constructions." These constructions are used when speakers want to express a passive idea but choose to do so in a different grammatical structure.
Man kann die Kopie nicht nur einfach lesen.
Die Kopie kann nur schwer gelesen werden.
Die Kopie ist nur schwer zu lesen.
Die Kopie lässt sich nur schwer lesen.
Das Kopie ist nur schwer lesbar.

In German grammar, "Konsekutivsätze oder Folgesätze" (consecutive clauses) are subordinate clauses that express a consequence or result. These clauses typically follow a main clause that expresses an action or situation, and they indicate what happens as a result of that action or situation.
| Es regnete stark, wir mussten drinnen
| Die Straßen waren vereist, es kam zu vielen

Der Finalsatz gibt den Zweck, die Absicht oder das Ziel der beschriebenen Handlung oder des Sachverhalts an. Man trennt den Finalsatz durch ein Komma vom übergeordneten Satz ab.

Conditional clauses express a condition and its possible outcome. In German, they often use subordinating conjunctions like "wenn", "falls", and "sofern", as well as prepositions like "bei", "im Falle", "mit", and "ohne". Here's an explanation of each:
Wenn ich Zeit habe, werde ich ins Kino gehen.
Falls es regnet, bleiben wir zu Hause.
Ich komme zur Party, sofern ich eingeladen werde.
Bei Regen nehmen wir einen Regenschirm mit.
Im Falle eines Unfalls, rufen Sie bitte die Polizei.
Im Falle eines Unfalls, rufen Sie bitte die Polizei.
Mit genügend Vorbereitung, können wir das schaffen.
Ohne deine Hilfe schaffen wir es nicht.
These conjunctions and prepositions are used to introduce the conditional clause, which is followed by the main clause indicating the consequence or result.
Wenn es regnet, werde ich zu Hause bleiben. (If it rains, I will stay at home.)
Bei gutem Wetter gehen wir spazieren. (In the case of good weather, we'll go for a walk.)
Falls du kommst, lade ich dich ein. (If you come, I'll invite you.)
Mit deiner Unterstützung können wir das schaffen. (With your support, we can achieve it.)
Im Falle eines Stromausfalls, haben wir einen Notstromgenerator. (In the event of a power outage, we have a backup generator.)

Auf meine Frage, ob Wohnungen nicht unbezahlbar würden, antwortete
-> Wenn die Form des Konjunktiv I identisch mit dem Indikativ ist, nutzt man stattdesssen den Konjunktiv II.

Bei der Umwandlung von direkter in indirekte Rede müssen Pronomen, Posesssivartikel und ggf. Zeit- und Ortsangaben angepasst werden.

contents.title: Alteration on Roles of the Architect in Contemporary Social Context
contents.keywords: autonomy of architecture; altermodernity; architecture and politics; political dystopia; deprogression

children.value:
The scope of this article is to interrogate ill-defined social paradox that resulting
non-functioning built environment within the framework of cause-effect relationship,
highlight the possible negative outcomes of given situation, pointing out discussions on the
role of architects and performance or control mechanisms in order to be able to create better
built environment.

The anthropocentric point of view gradually became prevailing paradigm in the world by
chain reaction initialized after period of Renaissance as a projection to this, especially since
19th Century role of architect gradually reshaped as rather than being servant to elite or
authority they gained autonomy and identical significance at some extend as discourse of
modernism promised to offer solutions for problems of contemporary world (e.g.
overpopulation, technological improvements, wars, enormously grown cities, migration et
cetera) and steer the new world society. Moreover as Kate Nesbitt points out paradigms

in
which postmodern discourse built upon, focused even more on fixation and rectification of
social paradoxes and complications.

However in 21th Century it would not be wrong to say that is unable to follow traces of
humanitarian aspects in contemporary cities. The touch of architect is concrete on buildings
of prestige such as museums, airports, opera houses and skyscrapers; but rarely visible on
residential areas, stations, schools and community zones. In other words, places of everyday
life in which people spend most of their times are not receiving the necessary attention during
the design process of built environment. As a result mass production occurring as copying
which could be considered as failure in different aspects. On phenomenological perspective,
Christian Norberg-Schulz pointed out “Genius Loci” as he states:

props.code:
Man dwells when he can orientate himself within and identify himself within
environment, or, in short, when he experiences the environment as a meaningful.
Dwelling therefore implies something more than ‘shelter”. It implies that the spaces
where life occurs are places, in the true sense of the word. A place is space which has
a distinct character. Since ancient times the genius loci, or “spirit of place”, has been
recognized as the concrete reality man has to face and come to terms with in his daily
life. Architecture means to visualize the genius loci, and the task of the architect is to
create meaningful places, whereby he helps man to dwell. (Norberg-Schulz, 1979)

children.value:
Man dwells when he can orientate himself within and identify himself within
environment, or, in short, when he experiences the environment as a meaningful.
Dwelling therefore implies something more than ‘shelter”. It implies that the spaces
where life occurs are places, in the true sense of the word. A place is space which has
a distinct character. Since ancient times the genius loci, or “spirit of place”, has been
recognized as the concrete reality man has to face and come to terms with in his daily
life. Architecture means to visualize the genius loci, and the task of the architect is to
create meaningful places, whereby he helps man to dwell. (Norberg-Schulz, 1979)

In this scrutiny, by pointing out Genius Loci, Norberg-Schulz criticizes the what discourse of
modernism stripped off from built environments mostly caused by inappropriate application
of mass production even if the intentions were opposite. Another aspect of failure unfolded
by Kevin Lynch by this terms “imageability” and “wayfinding” as he states:

props.code:
A distinctive and legible environment not only offers security but also heightens the
potential depth and intensity of human experience. Although life is far from impossible
in the visual chaos of the modern city, the same daily action could take on new meaning
if carried out in a more vivid setting. (Lynch, 1960)

children.value:
A distinctive and legible environment not only offers security but also heightens the
potential depth and intensity of human experience. Although life is far from impossible
in the visual chaos of the modern city, the same daily action could take on new meaning
if carried out in a more vivid setting. (Lynch, 1960)

Being not able to provide necessary attention to design would also result to generation of
non-distinctive places which will prevent people from orienting themselves in the city. As a
result experiencing the city is not a valid notion anymore especially for Generation Z

as it
turned out something to afraid of, a subject of obscurity itself.

However shaping built environment that way is not the choice of architect. Whereas
architecture is directly related with politics, production of built environment is affected by
complex social paradox in which especially in non-developed countries the scope of
production prioritize income rather than life that place has to provide. Additionally
significance of urban design and autonomy of architecture is underestimated. Therefore, they
are excluded from the production of built environment which they has to be autonomous at
some extend. In fact even previously mentioned “prestige buildings” are not an exception for
the situation. The main reason behind being point of interest is marginal advertising potential
(i.e. Profit opportunities) which intended and designated by authoritative power of the capital.
Therefore another intention of modernism turns out as failure as relation with authority does
not changed but shifted it is figurative form to abstract phenomenon.

In this paper main scope is to interrogate ill-defined social paradox that resulting
non-functioning built environment, identify negative qualitative outcomes of situation and
pointing out discussions on role of architects and simulating performance or control
mechanisms in order to be able to create better built environment.

Meaning is an evolving phenomenon by time, culture and society. Additionally, the
multidisciplinary nature of architecture makes the context of its meaning fragile. In different
intervals of history, architecture partially overlapped by context of engineering, artistry and
craftsmanship. However changes the zones of overlapping, architecture kept its genuine
intersection zone and defined itself as autonomous discipline. Nonetheless, for further
discussions it is beneficial to point out differing point between artist and architect as Le
Corbusier states:

props.code:
The engineer and the architect have to work with other people’s money. They must
consider their clients and, like politicians,they cannot be too far ahead of their moment.
The artist, on the other hand particularly the painter, may generally find it nearly
impossible to live; but if he is able to establish one of those curious compromises by
means of which he can carry on a lean existence, he is at least free (at times) to project
himself on paper or canvas without necessary reference to anything or anybody; and to
make experiment and research for its own sake. (Le Corbusier, 1927)

children.value:
The engineer and the architect have to work with other people’s money. They must
consider their clients and, like politicians,they cannot be too far ahead of their moment.
The artist, on the other hand particularly the painter, may generally find it nearly
impossible to live; but if he is able to establish one of those curious compromises by
means of which he can carry on a lean existence, he is at least free (at times) to project
himself on paper or canvas without necessary reference to anything or anybody; and to
make experiment and research for its own sake. (Le Corbusier, 1927)

As Le Corbusier pointed the difference; the architect distinguish from the artist at point that
former has only bounded freedom so content of architect’s work is cannot be discussed
independent from social context.
Confusion of Meaning of Architect In the Society

The chain reaction of events started by enlightenment and followed by industrial revolution
resulted the emergence new transitionary social class. Social structure changed by revolutions

, demanded a built environment to serve life rather than given public space. In 19th century
by the redefinition of modernity architects started to be in service of stated demand in
general. On the other hand, by the scale and improvement of building technologies;
professions once they were one under architecture are separated as individual disciplines.
Civil engineering and city planning i.e. urban design could be given examples of this
segregation. A common misunderstanding maybe because of these historical references,
people has confusion about what should they expect from architect or what should be the
responsibilities and competencies of the architect.

In another aspect, it is assumed that people has adequate perception when participating
surveys. However surveys that their methodology bounded to declarations about life
satisfaction or qualities of built environment are not always providing reliable results. For
instance, the one could consider the non-functioning built environment as successful that he
or she living in, by comparing with the worse only because of that being not capable to
imagine qualitative superior which architect could provide. Therefore, it is important to
educate people about the context of discipline of architecture in order to be able to foundate
participatory

production of built environment. By healthy feedbacks qualities of built
environment could be improved ,by teaching the capabilities of design; demand and
cultivation for urban aesthetics

may be provided, welfare, life quality, hygiene, adaptability
(in terms of flora and fauna) and flexibility standards could be expanded.
Role of Architect in the Contemporary World

It is not possible to fit perpetually evolving phenomenon in rigidly defined boundaries.
However it is necessity to make a description in order to be able to comprehend the notion
and articulate within the scope of objectivity, fit in the context of social integrity and
jurisprudence. Therefore, to concretize by raw description in contemporary world, ideally,
role of architecture could be summarized to serve society by creating creative, functioning,
adaptive, flexible and pleasing built environment in the scale of autonomous structure
complexes which also can speak multidimensional level and has a harmonious role within
environment it belongs. Thereby it is important to incarnate the line between other roles
involving the production of built environment. In order to point out contextual meaning of
discipline of architecture Canan Seyhun states:

props.code:
When regarded as a discipline, it is necessary to evaluate architecture with regard to
its various interrelationships. The discipline of architecture has a multidimensional
character, which assimilates with many theoretical and practical realities. It is possible
to consider architecture as an art, a profession, a science, or as a discourse; and
therefore, it is possible to evaluate an architectural work by means of its many levels;
such as its conceptual, artistic, intellectual, and utilitarian levels. An architectural
work could be evaluated as an art object; having its own aesthetic characteristics, or as
a cultural product; reflecting the conditions of the society, or as a utilitarian
apparatus; satisfying the necessities of intended functions. Not only the tectonic
properties but also the theoretical origins of it could be assessed. (Seyhun, 2004)

children.value:
When regarded as a discipline, it is necessary to evaluate architecture with regard to
its various interrelationships. The discipline of architecture has a multidimensional
character, which assimilates with many theoretical and practical realities. It is possible
to consider architecture as an art, a profession, a science, or as a discourse; and
therefore, it is possible to evaluate an architectural work by means of its many levels;
such as its conceptual, artistic, intellectual, and utilitarian levels. An architectural
work could be evaluated as an art object; having its own aesthetic characteristics, or as
a cultural product; reflecting the conditions of the society, or as a utilitarian
apparatus; satisfying the necessities of intended functions. Not only the tectonic
properties but also the theoretical origins of it could be assessed. (Seyhun, 2004)

Thus, with accurate precision Seyhun identifies boundaries of discipline within the scope of
completeness and correctness. In 21. Century on intellectual level architects actions evolving
into being curators, activists and critics rather than being in active role of shaping built
environment. Reasons of stated situation will be articulated in next chapter.
Critique of Social Paradoxes of Present-Day

In present-day production of built environment is outcome of complex social structure which
previously mentioned as ill-defined paradox. According to Pava: “Social paradox is a
pervasive, continuing dilemma between incompatible yet interdependent activities (i.e.
between regulators and the regulated).” (Pava, 1981)

Present-day examples and outcomes will be discussed upon two exaggerated limit points by
opposite perspectives. The former will articulate the absolute autonomy of architect, while
the latter will mention bypassing the autonomy of architecture i.e. excluding the architect
from its product.

As previously mentioned, since 19th century the architect gained its own autonomy; in fact
with its expanded jurisdiction, arguably the architect itself turned into a figure of authority
which could be explained by lack of control mechanism. Thus, practices of modernus

began
to behave in compulsive attitude rather than given promises of offering a new life, which also
could be supported by bearing of the discourse of postmodernism. However, following
interval did not progressed but shifted the situation. The birth of notion, the Starchitect

could
be an example. Maybe unconsciously but architecture turned out, or at least prioritized being
an object of self-representation instead of the representation of authoritative power.

Individuals may choose not to interact with art objects, but this is not a valid case for
architecture. Thus, unlike the artist who has absolute freedom, the architect cannot prioritize
self-representation in its work. Architecture itself could become an art object; however, since
it has to serve people or bear a social responsibility it has some constraints in which
distinguishes it from an individual art object. In another fold, such attitude also disrupts
perception of role about architect perceived by the society, as well as the image of architect
for architects of future and blur the participatory production of built environment which
discussed in previous chapter.
Excluding Architecture from Production of Built Environment

As opposed to former second extremum point could be given example as bypassing the
autonomy of architecture. This condition is more tangible in non-developed countries, but
also occurring developed countries as well. Hence at some extent especially in less-developed
societies on intellectual level the role of architect or designer started to be seen as
insignificant or easily be replaced, and some professionals claim for being that replacement.
Changing state of autonomy stated by Michael Hays and Lauren Kogod:

props.code:
When the issue of autonomy re-emerged in the 70s, architecture was in the peculiar
situation of being eroded from within by having become a service industry completely
determined by the building technology and programmatic demands of the time. On the
other hand, it had been challenged from outside the discipline by behaviorism,
sociology, pseudo-positivist history and pseudo-scientific discourses that tried to
explain architecture away in terms of how people behaved, or what response they
checked off on a questionnaire. Formal issues had given way to these statistical and
operational analyses. Architecture found itself without cultural or disciplinary
specificity... In contemporary vocabulary, we could say that architecture found itself
deterritorialized. It lost its domain; it lost the cultural realm that it had controlled. It
had to, therefore, re-territorialize itself by rediscovering, reasserting or reinventing its
codes. (Hays, 2002)

children.value:
When the issue of autonomy re-emerged in the 70s, architecture was in the peculiar
situation of being eroded from within by having become a service industry completely
determined by the building technology and programmatic demands of the time. On the
other hand, it had been challenged from outside the discipline by behaviorism,
sociology, pseudo-positivist history and pseudo-scientific discourses that tried to
explain architecture away in terms of how people behaved, or what response they
checked off on a questionnaire. Formal issues had given way to these statistical and
operational analyses. Architecture found itself without cultural or disciplinary
specificity... In contemporary vocabulary, we could say that architecture found itself
deterritorialized. It lost its domain; it lost the cultural realm that it had controlled. It
had to, therefore, re-territorialize itself by rediscovering, reasserting or reinventing its
codes. (Hays, 2002)

It is possible to observe in everyday life spaces applications of insufficient or non-functioning
built environment which lack the aspects of quality; especially in terms of intrinsic and
intellectual values. Practically all of the cases has a common point of that excluding or not
giving significant attention to role of architect and urban designer in production of built
environment or even the built environment which has to be designed in order to satisfy its
users needs actually prioritize the income for those who build it. Thereby, it turns out to a
capital market rather than place to live. Besides if society does not have necessary perception
to demand the architecture which described in previous chapter; our built environments
cannot be developed, even deprogression could possibly observed as well as in the civilization itself.
It could be summarized as “We shape our buildings and afterwards our
buildings shape us”. (Churchill, 1941)

The Capital mentioned as decisive power in the production of built environment. However if,
as a fact, the income is fundamental parameter of welfare; why is it should not be the
authority to shape the built environment? Briefly, because of the difference of objectives and
focus of short-term goals. Competency for the Olympics and resulted urban transformations
could be an example for the case.

props.code:
Even though the primary purpose of being a host city is to serve as the location for
sporting events, there must be much more at stake than merely providing a venue for
sport competitions. Much attention has been given to the economic impact and tourism
impact of hosting the Olympics which stresses the role of the Games themselves. 'What
has been neglected is how the Olympics are related to the long-term goals of the city.
(Hiller, 1998)

children.value:
Even though the primary purpose of being a host city is to serve as the location for
sporting events, there must be much more at stake than merely providing a venue for
sport competitions. Much attention has been given to the economic impact and tourism
impact of hosting the Olympics which stresses the role of the Games themselves. 'What
has been neglected is how the Olympics are related to the long-term goals of the city.
(Hiller, 1998)

Even if the Olympics provides reliable income and fulfill the expectations of the capital, if
not planned adaptively; providing a venue for sport competitions will result derelict gaps
within the urban texture. Therefore egocentric nature of capital economy does not prioritize
life which idealistically, the built environment should provide.

In 21. Century by given reasons, it would be not wrong to say especially in less-developed
countries everyday built environment is lacking intrinsic, intellectual, aesthetic and even
fundamental functional requirements of place It could be said that there is a serious political
and social problem exists in this situation and its negative outcomes could also be seen by
quantitative measurements. Rigidity of built environment enforces society to fit in the
boundaries of what defined as normal

; suburbs as bleak strangling points of city, birth of
exurbs

, preference to live and socialize in virtual dimensions, solitary of people living in
cities, obsession of safety, perception of city as a subject of fear, augmented perception

issues
, crime and rise on mental disorders

could be given as examples. By all means
non-functioning built environment may not be the only reason of those problems but should
be pointed out as one of the major reasons.

When Kaufmann family asked for a house from Frank Lloyd Wright; even if they had some
expectancy in their mind, they probably did not expected that Wright will give them the
opportunity of being able live with the waterfall

. Designers of built environment should 12
have their autonomy since they could decipher the multidimensional requirements of space
and create a work that capable to embody the interdisciplinary values of architecture in
singularity. However, when a system became too autonomous it may be blinded to see the
whole or be tend to exclude features easily which are valuable to others. Thus, it is important
to have control mechanisms to align and improve architectural work in order to be able to
serve society and civilization. In that point participatory design process that Jon Lang argued
could foundate the healthy built environment; but conditions could only provided by
understanding the meaning of architecture and convey it through society.

even the most vicious practices of humanity was 13
arguably better than today in terms of providing leaks for progression. Although we are
rationalized, technologically advanced and consider ourselves as civilized; it would not be
true to say that we are progressed in every aspect. Dystopia differs from the dark times by its
completeness in which there is no more opportunity to change. On the assumption, we do not
see and solve our problems in reality then even if we do not call it, we will start to live in the
modern dystopia.

On the subject of the architecture of the 21. Century, it is crucial to point out, problems of
built environment caused by social paradoxes rather interdisciplinary or other aspects in our
reality. Since the built environment is shaped directly by politics social infrastructure has to
be revealed for being able to diagnose this ill-shaped situation. Additionally, even if it is not
the actual part of design process, since they have to bear social responsibility, architects
should contribute as curators, educators, activists and critics in order to be able to shape our
built environment in more idealistic way and advance our civilization.

This is my self citation notation. I required to create this documents since I could not find both reliable syntactically coherent and citation guide.
Citation might fully grammatical syntactic but might take long time to write and looks ugly.
Citation might be elegant but consist of a lot of exceptions and problematic cases.
Some aspect considered, consistency, readability, extensibility and aesthetics.
Aim of this study to mix a set elegant and systatic citation setup that includes vast range of sources without question marks.
Three types of citation is held in this work these are
: Most compact form of citation. Not favored due to preventation of readability. However it is convenient on some cases.
: Often contains explanation or specific information (ex. page in book)
: Contains full information about to source
Citation gives minimum three of five
: What is the name of work?
: When it is published or settled as frozen entity in history?
: How do we reach it? Access link / doi etc.
The question why could be answered within the text or in footnotes but it is not a part of citation.
One or information might be missing or not included. However, the order of the information is always the same and a citation should contain minimum 3 of the metadata information.
Each metadata information is separated and ended by . (dot) from each other except for
If the metadata is not conventional type: dissertation, book, article, newspaper. It should be indicated with square braces.
The source of the work is written italic. It might be a chapter of book, article in journal or a book itself.
Part of something relationships indicated through quotation marks.
If the source name is in diffent language than article. The translation might be given in square braces after the name.
Page numbers are categorical exception handled as how. comes after date with : separation.
Indicates a selection between given options
Who produced the work? Author, editor, producer etc.
In bibliography reference last name is written first separated by comma (,)
If author has more than one names, only first name is written full rest is shortened by first letter.
In bibliography reference last name is written first separated by comma (,) First name or names written shortened by dot (.) at the end.
Last Name 1, First Name First Letter 1. and Last Name 2, First Name First Letter 2.
Acemoğlu, D. and Robinson, J. A.
Only first author name and constant abbreviation et al. (Latin abbreviation means "and others")
Last Name of First Author et al.
Sometimes authors uses nicknames for anonymity. In such cases pseudonym is written as it is with (pseudonym) constant. But if the pseudonym is well known the constant might be avoided.
What is the name or title of the work?
When the work is produced or published?
Multiple publications in the same year
How to find or accessed to the document
Articles are written text published in newspaper, journal, online platform or as book chapter. The most common type is appears as journal.

The Bell System Technical Journal, Vol. 27: 379–423, 623–656, July, October.

Archrist is a versatile assistance addon designed for the Wrath of the Lich King expansion pack in World of Warcraft. This project integrates a diverse range of functionalities to enhance the gaming experience, created through drawing inspiration and code inspection from well-established addons like ElvUI, WeakAuras, Spy, and others.

Organizes and categorizes people in your group (raid or party) based on their specs into four main roles: tank, healer, mdps, rdps. This helps in tracking healer's mana, creating interrupt or Aura Mastery queues for better group synchronization.
Tracks important group spells in your party and displays them in a simple frame for easy reference.
Filters out greed loots for a cleaner chat frame.
Reminds you to check your posture at intervals.
Retrieves crafting guides from warcrafttavern.com. Calculates estimated material cost for your profession leveling, adapted to your current level. Shows you what to craft next.
An experimental feature that allows you to create and edit your own guides. However, it's not yet fully implemented.

Allows you to take notes about people and grade them with five main quantitative categories. Notes and grades are displayed upon mouseover. If you have a negative grade for someone, it warns you when they are in the same group with you.
A simple todo list that allows you to create notes to be checked out or completed at another time.
A single-click macro to select either flying or ground mount of your preference.
A level-adjusted single-click disenchanting macro that disenchants every item in your backpack within a given item range.

A small chromium-based web scraper designed to automate the systematic retrieval of diverse data types, including text, tabular information, and visual content from the internet. Its primary purpose is to facilitate the extraction of reference materials relevant to traditional drawing practices.
The project is structured, incorporating Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) principles, notably emphasizing the implementation of key design patterns such as the
. These concepts enhance the modularity and extensibility of the codebase, contributing to a robust and maintainable solution.

Central to its functionality are various adaptors crafted to interface well-known platforms such as Pinterest, Artstation, and Github. Each adaptor is engineered to seamlessly interact with the specific structure and content presentation of its respective website, ensuring optimal data retrieval efficiency.

Cauldron is a compact CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) cooking learning side project designed to represent cooking recipes through three essential metadata components: ingredients, tools, and steps. Primarily crafted as a submodule for potential integration into a broader nutrition database project, Cauldron serves as a practical exercise to enhance web development skills, focusing on a decoupled front-end and back-end architecture to facilitate compatibility with diverse interfaces.
Create, delete, retrieve, and update recipe data, ensuring efficient management of culinary information.
Retrieve nutrition values for selected recipes, providing users with essential dietary insights.

Implement a recommendation system based on filtering criteria such as tools, ingredients, tags (e.g., vegan, seafood), required time, and difficulty. Enhancing user experience by suggesting relevant recipes.
Integrate basic 3D models using three.js to animate and visualize cooking steps, offering a unique and interactive learning approach during the cooking phase.
Establish a connection to a database, ensuring data persistence and scalability for future expansion and integration into larger projects.

During the Fall semester of 2019-20, I participated in a highly productive media course led by Professor Dr. Pelin Yoncaci Arslan. The course focused on graph theory, data, and information mapping theories and techniques, aligning them with the field of media studies.
I engaged in collaboration for two distinct projects aimed at experimentally mapping and relating information and data.
First Project: "The City as a Medium" by Friedrich Kittler (1996)

The task involved mapping the complex article by Friedrich Kittler, which creatively intertwined various theories and methods from different fields. Our approach was to categorize the content into headers, people, places, concepts, events, objects, and analogies. We sought to emulate Kittler's method of creatively describing and linking these elements. The visualization of these connections was executed using an interactive graph system originally designed for Alysii PI (Planetary Interactions), utilized for visualizing complex industry production processes in the virtual game EVE Online.
Second Project: Aikaterini Laskaradis Foundation Archive (1420-1919)

In this project, we aimed to map an archive comprising over 4000 drawings created by various travelers between 1420 and 1919. These visual materials were classified into 13 categories, allowing for one visual to exist in multiple categories. Utilizing a semi-analog filter, we rendered this information on a web interface. This interface enabled users to filter visuals based on years, observe production trends over time, and directly access specific visuals.
Both websites stemming from these projects are currently active and accessible for use.
The Maze Path Visualizer is a project I developed to explore and illustrate various computer science concepts. The project encompasses the application of the following learned concepts:
Implementation and utilization of Dictionary, Set, Queue, and Stack.
Implementation and visualization of Breadth-first and Depth-first search algorithms.
Incorporation Event-driven model in the project's structure.
Adherence to a Model-View-Controller architecture for effective organization and separation of concerns.
Practice of debugging to ensure the robustness and reliability of the project.

Developed a 3D renderer project to study computer graphics. In the process, I learned to integrate different C++ libraries into my project. I wrote my own 4x4 Matrix and 2/3/4-dimensional Vector libraries and arithmetic operation functions. The project involved using linear algebra for perspective projection and applying various computer graphics techniques like face culling, blending, and depth-stencil testing.

Dichotomy is a turn-based competitive board/strategy game that could be played between 2 to 6 players in which players make choices at each step, taking into account the behavior of the other players. To win the game, good strategy with the factor of luck must be present together. The game can be played at different difficulty levels depending on the preference of the player group.
The game draft is in the hypothetical phase. As it has not been tested, it may contain unforeseen logical problems or imbalanced cases.

The game space is created through combining hexagonal cards (module or dichotomy cards) to form a big hexagon form (map or board). Dichotomy cards are arranged randomly on the hexagonal game map. This condition introduces the factor of luck and creates an slightly different variation for each game. Map size is adjusted to include 13 module cards on the diagonal. Each session is aimed to last between 25-40 minutes to avoid the game becoming repetitive and overwhelming.
Each player starts on a corner of the hexagonal map. Players' positions relative to each other are positioned so that they are uniformly distributed across the game board.

Each player starts the game with five basic stats. These are Health, Hunger, Stamina, Strength and Speed.  Dichotomy cards show the player's position on the map. Only one player can be on a card at a time. Rotating on clockwise, players move by choosing one of the cards adjacent to their current dichotomy card. Each dichotomy card gives one negative and one positive property, e.g. +1 speed, -1 hunger.  Players have stats that affected by dichotomy cards.
Allows to player endure bad conditions if reaches zero, player dies.
Decreases one on each step if reaches zero player dies.
Power of player to handle encounters. Either against card or players.
Decreases one on each step. If zero player must one turn to gain.
Determines how many tiles player could move at once.

Each player gets a player card that has slot for cardriges of each stat. As player moves on the dichotomy card, one applies the stat changes on their card by giving/taking color distincted stat cardridges. Player cannot fill more than maximum amount of the stat. Each player should explicitly show their stat cards to other players.
Figure 4: Player Sheet and Stat Cartridges
The game can be won in more in various ways
By eliminating all the other players
Reaching the safe zone in the middle
By visiting 3 players starting place and acquiring their spawnstones.
are step-over decisions that affects player stats. It contains minimum 3 basic information. These are: name of the card, positive aspect, and negative aspect.

There are three groups of dichotomy cards distinguished by color.  These groups are there to prevent players from moving around the map with uniform ease, and to create some alignment rules to prevent randomization from creating cul de sac situations that players lose at the early game. In other words, randomization is intended to introduce the factor of luck into the game, whereas alignment rules are there to prevent chance of being the dominant factor and overriding the player's decisions.

The card the player steps on is flipped over and grayed out. This card loses its effect until the player exits the adjacent cards. At the end of each round the non-adjacent cards are reactivated. In order to win the game, the player needs to create a progressive strategy by balancing their stats on the maps and reading the actions of the other players.
Variations of dichotomy card is to be added considering the balance to extend the complexity of game.

Player could attack and kill other players. To hit another player, target player should be in the attack range by the player. Attacking another player costs 1 hunger and energy equal to players strength. If attacker players energy lesser than his/her strength, then player hit strength is regarded equivalent to as his/her stamina. Hit amount is decreased from attacked player's health. If it the health of attacked player reaches zero. Attacked player dies and attacker takes the position of attacked player, otherwise positions stays same.
There are certain single-use items added on the map with some rules. That enhances the stats extensively beyond limits, or provides unique abiltiy
Players have a technology tree and materials among map to create items in complexity level 2.

In a post-apocalyptic world, there is scarce of sources to accommodate all. Survivalists compete against each other against each other to live.

holds the subtle message of this game. One of the principles that I have adopted in the late stage of my life as I have learned through experience. I encounter often the falsification about the perception of the concept of decision. As it to be regarded something to gain but at the same time not to lose. A decision, choosing one of the two or more options. It opens up a new path, but it also means that other paths are closed. It might seem about a cruel reality. Yet it bear an austere elegance and beauty because decisions are the mere qualities of character that describes who we are. Accepting the responsibility of two-sided condition of a decision not only make us more mature but progress as a being. As a result, the game aimed to express the statement in an entertaining way.

Swapfold is a single player origami puzzle/storyline-rpg mix top-down platformer game with a unique fundamental feature. Players must replicate actions on real world in order to find some solutions to puzzles. The main idea of the game to establishing a ground to show that games has potential as an environment to be a platform of education. On the completition of the game player should be able to learn few origami pieces through the method of associative learning.
Figure 1: Basic level origamis selected for each chapter

# Story
Our player is an apprentice mage who has to train portals. His supervisor gives him extraordinary tasks to complete. In order to understand how interdimensionality works you should be able to accurately represent and simulate them in simple dimensions. Idea comes from quartenions. So he/she starts to learn to play with simple tasks. However, during one of his tasks something goes wrong and a portal opens to demonic world of caridia. Now our characters needs to focus on his training to overcome this problem.    
Story | Draft | Hidden Test 
not: burayi yeniden yaz story pek iyi degil.

Gameplay starts with a simple platformer game with moving around and exploring the world. With a simple mixed combat and puzzle feature for complex spells. Like a cookbook analogy in programming our character learns simple unitary modular folding techniques to create simple origami pieces, each of which associated with a power word, that could be used combine and casts spells ingame.  This techniques progresss further on a skill tree. It is aimed that the skill tree also resembles what player learned in real life as well. On each chapter player requires to create an origami piece. Writing a mark on number on each fold. At the end opening crafted origami piece on 2D reveals a map on how to solve a puzzle in game.

Each power word is associated with a folding technique. Player uses keyboard shortcuts to cast power words. Spells are usually combination of (usually 3 or 4) few power words. In RPG combat player must cast spells. A complex set of power words represent portals as well as origami pieces.
Each power word is learned through a simple puzzle.
Figure 2: Fold and Power Word Asssociation on Skill Tree
Basic game mechanics is a adjusted combination of two main mechanics. Those are moderate paced, environmentally interactive top-down RPG game play and puzzle solving.
Each spell is combination of one or more power words. During RPG combat, player uses the combination of power words through
to cast spell to overcome challenges. This combinations further helps player to solve puzzles through replicating origami pieces in real life.
Example systems in real games (Ultima Online, Skyrim, Magicka).
Casting a spell requires a small amount of time. Each cast process has three periods. Those are:
states represents a failing cast. If player ends casts too early, spell fizzles, simply fails without any effect. After the end of fizzle,
period begins. During success, effect of spell increases exponantially until until excession period. The latest stage of the cast is
state is guaranteed failing cast and harms the player depending on the combination of spells. The harm is maximum at start and decreases parabolically up to half of maximum success effect.
Figure 3: Spell Effect Change In Relation To Cast Periods

On the combinations, different power words affect the cast time and proportions of the cast periods. Along with the mastery and usage frequency of the player.
Through the mix of spell word combination and progressive casting, it is aimed to create create precision input button combos, fun to play but hard to master base combat mechanics of the game.

Player requires to solve a puzzle a to unlock, final chapter battles in game. A typical puzzle is again combination of power words, ingredients or keys to be used on certain sequence or places. This sequence is revealed through creating an origami piece through instructions explored in sub-chapters. On each fold player writes a power word on paper in real world. After completing and unfolding the origami piece, map for solving the puzzle is revealed. The sequence of instructions, and words are randomized to create unique map for each instance of the game.
Game consist of chapters each chapters corresponds an origami piece, and chapters consists of sub-chapters each of one corresponds to fold-technique.

During sub-chapter with different hints player learns origami by retrieving knowledge such as which fold-technique to be used, how many times and where. Player could replicate this information step to create origami piece.
On certain steps, player are given some additional power words (as runes) for portal keys. On this case, the given rune needs to be written on  indicated area before applying the fold.

Completing the chapter, will result to complete the origami as well. However, to unlock next chapter, player requires to handle a boss fight. The boss fight room always resembles the unfolded paper of origami piece. On certain periods, boss stops and an area is indicated by color or light. On this time player should go to given area and cast the passing power word in given time.
If player had replicated given fold techniques in real life, unfolding the origami should reveal the true power words, in that player could use true power word to cast the portal.
Upon completing successful RPG boss fight with the combination of origami puzzle player defeats the boss and gains access to the new chapter. Along with learning an origami in real life.
Description selected origami for the chapter as a composition of folding steps.
Decision on which steps to write a power rune on fold.
Writing of appropriate questline for each fold and rune to reveal map.
Design of boss fight mechanics and space that bears resemblance of unfolded origami.

As a general principle, it is aimed to increase the interaction with the environment for player. Environment is not only frozen entity to move and orient for next encounter but also, something to be aware of and act depending of the requirements of the place. Player should be able to change, alter or impact on the environment. At the same time strategicaly use it for personal progression.
Frost based spells has multipliers to hit greater to wet enemies.
Player should avoid using fire spells on environment with dry woods to create fire.
Player should position themselves tactically to avoid impact boulder rolls, and even use this phenomenon to encounter with enemies.

One of the problems that I have encountered in online games, that crafted objects costs lesser than material itself. Which is often wrong compared to the real world. The problem is gathering costs labor, however crafting does not, as a result since the material has variety of usage it worth more. To compete with this problem. It is aimed to set alternative progression mechanics such as crafting to be supported by engraved mini games to include and value them in labor. On further extreme, who whole complex game could be considered as a composition of mini games too.
Lockpicking mechanism in Elder Scrolls series.

The mechanic requirements to solve puzzles or progression is aimed to be engraved in-game as much as possible. Player should not progress with grind with frozen state of mind, but immerse him/herself in the game content and try to solve a problem to make a progress.
Trolls could be killed by using fire spells learned through a book (Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim, 2011)

On crafting, player must adjust the necessary conditions to create best possible variations of weapon. This information could be retrieved from someone, or something from ingame. To avoid duplication of the solution outside of the game. Given sources are randomized every game. On example, to forge a good sword, player should set the temperature to correct level. The level is described as a color of something (for instance a peach) ingame by someone or some text. Player should get a peach to compare colors to see correct level adjustment.

Another factor to establish an immersive environment is to push player to think and theorycraft the problem space created in-game. To create this environment, I consider, technology, and skill trees are good method to create complexity and considering people to think over variances and new possibilities to play and interract with the game. However, I belive skills trees should not shadow the players control over the character. Fundamental success should still be binded to player.

A time system tracks day/night cycles and calendar to set events. To bind sense of time to certain events such as puzzles or social/unique events ingame that enhances to create more surrounding environment in parallelity with the idea of Gesamkunstwerk.

As a fundamental aspect of any role-playing game inventory system is aimed to include in Swapfold. To be able to progress on character, use of materials to create more powerful objects and increase environmental interaction.

Describing environment as modules and computationally bind this parts to describe seamlessly transitive places. The idea is to create relatively unique experience on each seed, as well as preventing the rote progression.
Example games using described system: Diablo series, Valheim, Don't Starve
Map randomization: As a part of prodecural environment creation parts of the map is randomly customized
Puzzle randomization: To prevent same written guide to pass the game without playing it. The fold hints are given randomly to form a unique form for each puzzle instance.

my first well organized programming project was a maze solver that I have created in 2022. I trained a programming concepts, skills to feel comfortable on the development and simple software architecture to set interface and communicate with the user.
This project is completed by using a tutorial on console level, then UI is implemented though using TKInter library by python and MVP software architecture.
More detailed information about the project and documentation could be accessed from the link below.

On next level I have made a clone version of well known breakout game. I have familiarized myself in Unity game engine tools. And wanted to finish a game from start to end, in most basic version, with menu, UI elements and playable level.

Aim of the game was to be able to famialirize with gaming engines and process of creating a game from start to finish. During the development, I have simulated the base game logic, set up conditions for win and lose, a basic user interface and practiced software architecture patterns to solve certain problems.

This is my first project on an actual game. I have developed my own addon on World of Warcaft that has many functions mainly helps to organizational tasks and raid control. Again I have trained various computer architecture I have isolated my modules from each other to create protected variations, and communicate between modules. in this project I have also used various libraries to build my interface. Learned to read structed documentation created by other people and use it in my own project.

After completing my first project I wanted to deep dive into more complex game that households subsystems such as inventory, day/light, crafting, skill-trees and growing objects, looting, building etc. To work, I have started to learn repertoire of functilities on 2D TopDown rpg clone. I seek solutions for how to create world by creating and using tile palette. How to put player character and make it move. How to implement inventory system, etc.

Through simulating a pixel art / cel shader on 3D game with camera aligned 2D elements. Below you can see my shader writing attempts. However, they are still primitive.
Custom Shader Test: Using Scene Light for Dynamic Shading

I have written some questlines in Turkish speaking custom Ultima Online servers in the timeline of 2015-2016. Few of them are implemented in-game however stories are shortened to great extend. There are some visuals from implemented ingame content.

During the course we have attempted to discover various ways of communication, and transformation between mediums. contents.title: Why I want to make games?
contents.author: Kutay Coskuner

children.value: Hello world, my name is Kutay Coşkuner, and this is my game design portfolio.

This work has composed of four chapters. While the first three chapters contain my work on game design, in this chapter that I added later, I tried to list the reasons why I wanted to make a game. If you are not willing to read a relatively long essay, you can skip this section.
Otherwise, thank you for your time.
Game as Total Work of Art

I have great affection for analyzing and creating things. Since the childhood I found myself in virtual dimensions of computer games as a vast field of exploration. I am amazed by how people combined designed systems and worlds using mathematics and art to resemble either life itself or non-existent world out of their imaginations.

During my master education I have meet with various concepts and persons that contributed me a lot. One of these concepts were Gesamtkunstwerk, a total work of art. Concept coined by Richard Wagner to describe what he aimed to create rather than aesthetic experience, a new dimension that could surround the experiencing person and make them to feel something immersive and new. I was very excited by this concept because it clearly articulated the idea that imagination and artistic production could offer something more than an aesthetic experience that I was enthusiastic about.

Although Wagner aimed to create this through the medium of opera, today many considers cinema as the new form of total work of art. Cinema is powerful enough for us to feel and experience completely new out of this world. I have no objection to the opinion that cinema. However when I first heard about the concept, first thing come to my mind was Ultima Online. An overengineered mmorpg by Richard Garriott was able to create this dimension for me, with a further point that cinema could not reach in that time, the interaction. Cinema could make people cry, to experience something new but they are rarely include viewer as participant to their world (There are some discrete limited examples such as Black Mirror). In my experience, computer games and architecture are proven to be able to carry the potential of Gesamkunstwerk. They are capable to create, through an extended level of interaction, one could experinnce new world and beyond, one could interact with it though decisions and characteristic features. However due the required complexity of these works, we rarely encounter such games. As a result, I have always had the desire to pass on my experience to others as if I had seen a new color. In order to show people that another life and a better world is possible, the concept of Gesamtkunstwerk offers the power to express this and computer games offer a method.

Secondly, in 2016 I met with a youtube channel Primer by Justin Helps.  He is simulating famous theories through animation, statistics, and computer science. On the one hand, I think the way he presents his thought experiments with statistically based proofs, and on the other hand, the way he expresses it in a clear and very understandable way, and the way he presents it with effort and visualization, I think creates extraordinary works. What the Primer videos made me realize is that they provide an extraordinary platform for data generation, experimentation, and scientific inference in sociology, economic and public science in my analysis of online gaming experiences.

To illustrate this, online games of a certain size and complexity have economies that are like small-scale simulations of real life. By analyzing the ledgers in these economies and analyzing the data, we can clearly observe behavioral patterns that parallel those in the real world. Can people's behavior change from cooperative to cooperative in crisis situations (See Corrupted Blood Incident - World of Warcraft) How does human behavior change with inflation (Gold Pruning Events - Ultima Online/ World of Warcraft) Can we channel the time people spend having fun into producing functional scientific output (See Project Discovery - Eve online). Some of the conclusions that I find functional in life are that money is not a measure of value but a representation mechanism, and that labor is the real value. The system of risk and reward and the balance of supply and demand advocated by classical economics does not work linearly. To summerize, I think that game platforms can exist as potential and powerful platforms for scientific experimentation and production other than private beneficial purposes, but that this potential is rarely used, although there are examples. As a game designer, I think this potential should be assessed.

I hesitate to add the third aspect, because previous attempts with similar premises, such as television and youtube, have not worked out so well, but I will add it anyway because it is my peak goal. I think games as an educational platform can contribute to social development to form a better society and environment.

In nature, when we look at the concept of game, we see that it works as a simulation that gives the living being the abilities that prepare it for life. I think a similar template can be applied to counter the current notion of games as a market commodity where entertainment is sold. I think that games have the potential to be not only a means of transmitting functional knowledge, as in the case of survival in nature, but also educational platforms that offer causality to create a more just society, to become bettere over nature and sustainable environment. To extend this idea, I would like to example from architecture (another Gesamkunstwerk) through famous illustration of Panopticon by Michael Foucault.

Foucault has seen architecture as inevitably political action. In other words, architecture changes society through subtle political statements through organizing, controlling, and defining the space. Foucault uses a blatant instance of the Panopticon to concrete his argument. Panopticon is a prison design produced as an idea experiment. The biggest problem of surveillance mechanisms is the numerical proportional difference between the actors. In other words, it is not possible to have a guard watch each prisoner, and it is not efficient either. Panopticon is a cylindrical prison, where in the middle, stands a watchtower for the guards, and prisoners in its perimeters. The overhead light prevents the prisoners from seeing the guards, while the guards are at any angle could observe each individual prisoners. Prisoners cannot know if they are being watched, as they cannot see the guards. Even if the guards are few in number, the prisoners have to act on the assumption that they are being watched. At the theoretical level, the problem is solved only with the spatial organization, namely architecture. Foucault has used it to express how architecture can shape human behavior through an extreme example like Panopticon. Although Foucault's example is negative and pessimistic, this potential is not only there to establish autocratic control, but to convey the causality phenomena that will make it possible to produce more free, just and sustainable environment for all. Indeed, as a more positive example, psychologist and educator Loris Malaguzzi referred to the place as the "third teacher" on the educational buildings, as it is referred to architecture could play a role to establish values such as equality, justice, freedom for all living beings and nature.

Beyond that, I think I have experimented with the idea that games can be educational platforms. To exemplify at the individual level, I got my thoughts on economics and sociology from my abstracted simulation experiences in games. I have seen how people act in crisis situations. Games taught me the difference between fact and image, and awareness of the ideas such as rhetoric over logic
, on social experiences. I learned the second language English through games, and the idea of the dichotomous relationship between chaos and order
, which later contributed to my master thesis in architecture. Regardless of the right or wrong of my thoughts, I think that games had a great impact on the formation of my intellectual identity.

To summarize, I believe that games have the potential to be a complete work of art, a platform for experimentation, as well as a platform for education and social development, but this potentials are rare except some subtle extraordinary cases. Just like the value that I have gained from games, I think that by creating works with this potential, I can add new dimensions to the perception of the game and create works that could add value to humanity that has not only have artistic and scientific value but also something that could allows us to create a better, self-sustainable, and fair society.
This is the end of my game design portfolio.
Thank you for your time and attention. :)
